p: Subtype B is the most prevalent HIV-1 lineage circulating in the Americas and its dissemination was probably initiated by the introduction of a founder strain from Central Africa into Haiti around the middle 1960s [ 8]. Between the late 1960s and the early 1970s, the subtype B seems to have moved out from the island of Hispaniola (shared by Haiti and the Dominican Republic) on several independent occasions, reaching the United States (US) and some neighboring Caribbean countries [ 8]. One subtype B variant introduced in the US was successfully disseminated within this country and to other countries around the world, establishing a pandemic clade (B PANDEMIC) [ 8]. Other subtype B variants, by contrast, remained mostly restricted to the Caribbean region and established a number of non-pandemic Caribbean clades (B CAR) [ 8, 9].
